```{r}
t=1:365
theta=seq(0,2*pi,pi/100)

seasonality<-function(t,m){
  x=(1-m/2.0)+m*cos(2*pi*t/365)/2.0
  return(x)
  }

#m=1


plot(t,seasonality(t,1),type="l",ylab="Relative transmission rate",xlab="Day of the year")
mycols=rainbow(length(seq(0,1,0.2)))
i=1
for(m in seq(0,1,0.2))
{
  x=seasonality(t,m)
  
  lines(t,x,type="l",col=mycols[i],lwd=3)
  i=i+1
}

tibble(m=seq(0,1,0.2)) %>%
```
